page.title: 15Recreation in Frome
page.content: We took a sample of 270 children and discovered that 160 usee the Sports Centre regularly, 100 used it seldom and only 11 never used it all. Swimming was the most popular sport as one would expect and Table Tennis second most popular. Of the ball games, football was the most popular in Winter and cricket in Summer. Other games like rugby, basketball and hockey were also played. Of the same sample all but five children went on holiday each year. The largest group (l53) had a holiday in Britain whilst others went abroad or alternated holidays abroad with ones in Britain. The car was by far the most popular mode of transport whether the children were holidaying at home or abroad. The coach was the least popular. by T.Frayling & C.Gilroy (l2)
